conclusion: Determine the electric field at point A due to charges 2q and -q.
Cube with charges 2q at (0,0,0) and -q at (L,L,L), point A at (L,0,0).
Midpoint O is at (L/2, L/2, L/2).
Distance from 2q to O is sqrt(3)L/2.
Distance from -q to O is sqrt(3)L/2.
Electric field at O due to 2q is (8kq/3L^2) r1.
Electric field at O due to -q is (-4kq/3L^2) r2.
Net electric field at O is (4kq/3L^2) (r1 + r2).
Magnitude of electric field at O is E = (4kq/3L^2) sqrt(2).
Distance from 2q to A is L.
Distance from -q to A is sqrt(2)L.
Electric field at A due to 2q is (2kq/L^2) i.
Electric field at A due to -q is (kq/2L^2) (i + j + k).
Net electric field at A is (5kq/2L^2) i + (kq/2L^2) j + (kq/2L^2) k.
Magnitude of electric field at A is (3sqrt(3)kq/2L^2).
Magnitude of electric field at A is (9sqrt(6)E/8).
